normalised: Lately, I have been really concerned about air quality, especially with Diwali right around the corner. Living in Delhi, you can practically taste the pollution some days! It is not just a Delhi problem though. I was recently in Patna visiting my grandparents, and the air quality there was equally worrying.

I remember learning about the importance of environmental conservation in school, especially the need to improve our air quality. My grandpa, Mister Sharma, often tells stories of how clear the skies were back in fifteenth August nineteen forty seven, when India gained independence. It is a stark contrast to what we see now.
